title: Java ScannernextShort()Method

metadata.description: Learn about Java ScannernextShort()Method with clear explanations and practical examples.

content_sections.title:
Java Scanner

Method

Example
Print the value of every short integer in the string
content_sections.content:
:
// Create a scanner object
Scanner myObj = new Scanner("An short is a number between -32,768 and 32,767");

// Print the value of every short in the scanner
while (myObj.has
  if (myObj.has
    System.out.println(myObj.
  } else {
    myObj.
  }
}
Definition and Usage
The

method returns the
short
value of the number that the 
The scanner is able to interpret digit groupings, such as using a comma for separating groups of 3 digits. The format of the groupings depends on the locale settings of the scanner, which can be changed with the
useLocale()
method.
If the
radix
parameter is used, then it interprets numbers using the radix. For example, a radix of 16 would interpret numbers as hexadecimal (digits 0 to 9 and A to F). If the
radix
parameter is not used then it interprets numbers using the scanner's radix which is 10 by default, but it can be changed with the
useRadix()
method.
What is a token?
A token is a sequence of characters separated from other tokens by delimiters. The default delimiter is a block of whitespace characters but it can be changed with the
useDelimiter()
method.
Syntax
One of the following:
public short 
public short 
radix
)
Parameter Values
Parameter
Description
radix
Optional. Specifies the radix used to interpret numbers. The radix specifies how many different symbols can be used to represent a digit in a number.

content_sections.title: InputMismatchException
content_sections.content:
- If the token does not represent a
short
type value.

content_sections.title: NoSuchElementException
content_sections.content: - If there are no more tokens in the scanner.

content_sections.title: IllegalStateException
content_sections.content:
- If the scanner has been closed.

summary: This tutorial covers Java ScannernextShort()Method concepts and techniques. You'll learn how to use Java ScannernextShort()Method effectively, including key principles, common patterns, and practical examples.
